verses.roman:
sūta uvāca
namaskṛtya gurūn vakṣye
vibhūtīr vaiṣṇavīr api
yāḥ proktā veda-tantrābhyām
ācāryaiḥ padmajādibhiḥ

synonyms: sūtaḥ uvāca—Sūta Gosvāmī said; namaskṛtya—offering obeisances; gurūn—to the spiritual masters; vakṣye—I shall speak; vibhūtīḥ—the opulences; vaiṣṇavīḥ—belonging to Lord Viṣṇu; api—indeed; yāḥ—which; proktāḥ—are described; veda-tantrābhyām—by the Vedas and the tantras; ācāryaiḥ—by standard authorities; padmaja-ādibhiḥ—beginning with Lord Brahmā.
translation: Sūta Gosvāmī said: Offering obeisances to my spiritual masters, I shall repeat to you the description of the opulences of Lord Viṣṇu given in the Vedas and tantras by great authorities, beginning from lotus-born Brahmā.
